main_definition: Being deserving of attention, respect, or a particular action due to certain qualities or achievements.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Meriting praise or admiration for one's character or actions
meanings_and_examples.example: The volunteer is truly worthy of our gratitude for the hours she has dedicated to helping others.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Being deserving of a particular reward or recognition
meanings_and_examples.example: His academic achievements make him quite worthy of receiving a scholarship to study abroad.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adequate or appropriate in quality, degree, value, or status
meanings_and_examples.example: Only the most worthy candidates should be considered for this prestigious award.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Capable of being trusted with a responsibility or task
meanings_and_examples.example: She is a very capable and worthy person to lead our team on an important project.
